poem:
"Metering our Futures: A Morning Musing"

In the margin of morning,
peeking through the window of print,
they spoke of clever meters and silent savings,
of currents drawn in the night's lull,
offering green salvation to our world.
Tonight, our car will sip from the grid, 
and we - cradled in the quiet motions 
of an unassuming hero,
will drift on dreams of lighter footprints.
